concept.title: Pipeline Memory
concept.shortdesc: uses memory when it runs a pipeline. To avoid causing out-of-memory errors on the host machine, you can configure the maximum amount of memory that can be used for the pipeline.

conbody.p: pipeline propertiesmaximum memorymemorymaximum for a pipelineBest practice is to configure the pipeline to use up to 65% of the Java heap size. For example, with the default Java heap size of 1024 MB, the highest setting for the pipeline memory should be 665 MB.

Use the Max Pipeline Memory pipeline property to define the maximum amount of memory to use. When you configure the pipeline, you can also configure the action to take when pipeline memory usage exceeds the configured amount.

p.note: To avoid errors, you might create an alert to indicate when the memory usage approaches the configured limit.
